formattedAddress: 110 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA
adrFormatAddress: 110 West End Ave, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Neighborhood store with a variety of bikes, equipment & apparel, plus fittings & repairs.

originalText.text: The best local bike shop! I've been going to TOGA for 15+ years (since the Chamber street days) and they are knowledgeable, kind and provide consistently great service. Will and his team offer friendly service and build relationships with plenty of regulars. They provide a variety of services, products, and rent bikes too. I have bought 2 bikes and accessories over time and my friends love the community roo. Support a local business and feel great about the safety and caring of you and your bike!

originalText.text: I've been going to Toga for over 15 years...purchased two bikes I've been thoroughly satisfied with for performance and durability. It's my trusted go-to  for maintenance, repair advice and more. The comp basic tune-ups for the life of your bike is a major plus.

text.text: I've been going to Toga for over 15 years...purchased two bikes I've been thoroughly satisfied with for performance and durability. It's my trusted go-to  for maintenance, repair advice and more. The comp basic tune-ups for the life of your bike is a major plus.

originalText.text:
Had absolutely terrible customer experience and judging by the comments it's not an exception.
Left my Brompton for a chain replacement and said if there is anything else feel free to fix it. Was texted later that a new sprocket needs to be installed. Said ok thanks.
The next day went to pick it up and as soon as I left I noticed something is wrong with my break because was loose and went all in without any resistance. Went back pointing the issue was acused it's not their fault and maybe I didn't notice the break pad missing before. Are you kidding me? That's not something you can miss when as soon as you press your break you notice it. Then was told multiple times can't be their fault because replacing the chain doesn't require that part to be touched. This went back and forth. I was threatened that the bike won't be fixed and I should be grateful they are doing me a favor... I paid 90$ for chain replacement and told you to let me know if you notice something else do be done. It took him 2min to fix it but 5min to argue with me and basically saying I am trying to scam them or something to fix something that's not their fault.
Well, all the best to you, conducting and treating your customers this way.

originalText.text: A place that has bicycles and equipment that is good, but the service is terrible. I went there to clean my bike, I paid the highest fare, $300. Then bought a $250 helmet. When I needed to change some pedals and went because I didn't have the tools, they treated me poorly, telling me that just because I bought something there doesn't mean I can come and ask for a tool for free. Without a doubt, I do not recommend it; they try to rip you off, and they can't even do a simple  with a smile.

originalText.text: I had purchased a TACX Neo2T bike trainer but could not for the life of me get an old Campy cassette from my old bike mounted properly. The lock ring wouldn't fit back on. Tried four other prominent bike shops in NYC, none of whom could get it to fit. Toga tried one lock ring, found it was wobbly, tried a spacer, found it was too much, then tracked down the proper Campy lock ring in their supply cabinet. Now I'm finally ready for winter training indoors.
